title: 8 cringeworthy phrases that are ruining your resume
text:
Writing a resume can be the most stressful part of job applications — you only have one page to sell yourself, so every single word matters.

Beware of filler phrases like "a proven track record" and clichéd buzzwords like "synergy."

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Writing a resume is arguably the most stress-inducing part of the job application process. You only have one page (or less, if you're using a fancy format) to prove to a hiring manager why they should hire you. As a result, every single word and properly placed comma matters.

Unfortunately, especially if you've churned out dozens of resumes in a heated job search, our resume language can get a bit outrageous.

Read more: 12 common grammar mistakes you're probably making right now (and how to avoid them)

These eight cringeworthy phrases are commonly used on job applications — even if everyone in HR hates them — because they're just such great fillers. If you've got any on your application, it's time to take them out ASAP. We've even given you what to say instead.
description: Beware of clichéd buzzwords like "synergy" — you only have one page to sell yourself on your resume, so every word matters.
